intro: Biscutella conquensis, commonly known as the Andean biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in the Andean regions of Peru and Bolivia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and its ability to thrive in high-altitude environments. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and leaves that are often glandular. Biscutella conquensis is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional Andean medicine.
